channel.title: 华尔街日报

item.title: 恭喜你，你刚刚升职了。等等，你还指望着那份新的大工作能给你加薪？

item.title: "Girls5Eva》主演 Busy Philipps 谈及自己小时候的怪癖："我有很强的主见，很容易迷恋自己喜欢的东西，这让其他孩子感到焦虑，他们希望我像他们一样--安静、酷。
item.description:
"Girls5Eva" star Busy Philipps on embracing her weirdness as a kid: "I had strong opinions and easily became obsessed with things I liked, which caused anxiety in other kids who wanted me to be like them—quiet and cool." https://t.co/udizE6HU1g https://t.co/udizE6HU1g

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 拳击手奥斯卡-德拉霍亚（Oscar De La Hoya）在拉斯维加斯再下一城--这一次，他将在拉斯维加斯建造一座豪华住宅，其中包括一个价值 40 万美元的私人洞穴和一个向其职业生涯致敬的房间。
item.description:
Boxer Oscar De La Hoya is going another round with Las Vegas—this time with a tricked out home with features like a $400,000 man cave and a tribute room that pays homage to his career https://t.co/6HmUAOxCCR https://t.co/6HmUAOxCCR

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 深夜节目主持人吉米-法伦（Jimmy Fallon）一直在等待谈论他的护肤程序。"从来没有人问过我，"他说。"我一直在求别人问我"
item.description:
Late-night host Jimmy Fallon has been waiting to talk about his skin care routine. “No one’s ever asked me,” he said. “I’ve been begging for someone to.” https://t.co/3Bg6lVWVkA https://t.co/3Bg6lVWVkA

item.title: 它看起来就像一个标准的纽约市停车场。但自 2024 年初以来，这座位于曼哈顿西村的建筑已经签订了超过 1 亿美元的交易。
item.description:

item.title: 一对空巢老人对另一项建筑工程毫无兴趣。三年后，耗资约 400 万美元，他们将一个原始的阁楼空间改造成了一个引人注目的现代住宅。
item.description:
A pair of empty nesters had no interest in embarking on another construction project. Three years and roughly $4 million later, they turned a raw loft space into a striking modern home. https://t.co/rdhIHdCssR https://t.co/rdhIHdCssR

item.title: 马丁-格林菲尔德（Martin Greenfield）于周三去世，他在大屠杀中幸存下来，后来为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）、勒布朗-詹姆斯（LeBron James）和巴拉克-奥巴马（Barack Obama）设计服装。他是美国制造业为何重要的非官方发言人。
item.description:
Martin Greenfield, who died Wednesday, survived the Holocaust and went on to dress Donald Trump, LeBron James and Barack Obama. He was an unofficial spokesman for why American manufacturing matters. https://t.co/mjGsRuRf0O https://t.co/mjGsRuRf0O

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 24, 2024

item.title: 十年前，在比弗利伍德花二三十万美元就能买到一栋房子。现在呢？"你不可能以低于300万美元的价格买到任何一条黄金街道上的地皮"。
item.description:
A decade ago, you could buy a house in Beverlywood for $200,000 to $300,000. Now? “You can’t buy just land on any of the prime streets for less than $3 million.” https://t.co/uXPRZ9CSOP https://t.co/uXPRZ9CSOP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 24, 2024

item.title: 他曾是一名律师，生活在美国梦中。后来，精神疾病让他的聪明才智与自己背道而驰。"他的姐姐说："我们以为他会得到他需要的帮助。相反，他失去了一切。
item.description:

item.title: 说到食品，通胀率仍在上升，这让许多消费者感到沮丧。您想在杂货店和餐馆省钱吗？华尔街日报》的 @heatherhaddon 将与 @annmariefertoli 一起回答您的问题。
item.description:

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 24, 2024
